questions.question: What is an acid?

options.label: a
options.text: A substance that will neutralise an acid

options.label: b
options.text: A substance that produces H+ ions when added to water

options.label: d
options.text: A chemical which changes colour when added to acids and alkalis

Pick the correct equation for the reaction between hydrochloric acid and iron oxide.

options.label: a
options.text: Hydrochloric acid + solid iron (III) oxide → iron (III) chloride solution + water

options.label: b
options.text: Hydrochloric acid + iron (III) oxide → iron (II) chloride solution + water

options.label: c

questions.question: In an exothermic reaction...

options.text: energy is released to the surroundings and the temperature of the surroundings increases

options.text: energy is absorbed from the surroundings and the temperature of the surroundings decreases

options.label: d
options.text: energy is released to the surroundings and the temperature of the surroundings decreases

options.text: energy is released to the surroundings and the temperature of the surroundings decreases

questions.question: When an exothermic reaction takes place, the reaction mixture gives out heat because...

options.label: a
options.text: more energy is released when new bonds are formed than is taken in when existing bonds in the reactants are broken

options.text: the radiation energy produced by the reaction has to be got rid of via diffusion

options.label: c
options.text: energy is always absorbed in a chemical change which makes new substances

options.label: d
options.text: in an exothermic change, the products are less stable than the reactants

questions.question: Here is the equation for the Haber process: N2 + 3H2 ⇌ 2NH3    How many moles of gases are there on each side of the equation?

options.text: The amount of ammonia is smaller

options.label: b
options.text: The amount of product is increased

options.label: c
options.text: The amount of reactant produced is larger

options.label: d
options.text: The reverse reaction occurs more quickly

options.label: d
options.text: Too much hydrogen and nitrogen are used

options.label: a

options.label: d
options.text: It is slower than the reverse reaction

options.label: c

options.label: d

questions.question: Some people use filter jugs in their homes. These jugs have a top part where the water is put in and passes through the filter. Which of the following are NOT usually found in the filters in these jugs?
What does the carbon in the filter do?

options.text: Removes any solid materials from the water

options.label: b
options.text: Reduces the levels of chlorine, pesticides and other organic impurities in the water

options.label: c
options.text: Discourages the growth of bacteria within the filter

options.label: d
options.text: Removes calcium, magnesium, lead, copper and aluminium ions from the water

questions.question: The crust...

options.label: a
options.text: is almost entirely solid but can flow

options.label: b
options.text: has an average thickness of 6km under oceans and 35km under continents

options.label: c
options.text: is mainly liquid, iron and nickel

options.label: d
options.text: is mainly solid, iron and nickel

questions.question: Alfred Wegener put forward a theory to explain the change in positions of the continents. His theory was that...

options.label: b
options.text: the continents had been forced apart by earthquakes

options.label: c
options.text: volcanic eruptions had caused them to separate

options.label: d
options.text: the shrinking crust had forced them apart

questions.question: Why did other scientists not accept Wegener's theory at the time?

options.label: a
options.text: They thought that the earth's crust was too thick

options.label: b
options.text: They had no way to explain how the continents could move

options.label: c
options.text: They thought the earth was expanding

options.label: d
options.text: They thought that the continents moved too slowly

questions.question: Current scientific thinking is that mountain ranges are formed...

options.label: a
options.text: by the earth's crust expanding as it heats up

options.label: c
options.text: by large-scale movements in the earth's crust

options.label: d
options.text: by weathering and erosion of old mountain ranges

questions.question: It is now accepted that the interior of the earth remains hot because of...

options.label: a
options.text: friction between the moving tectonic plates

options.label: b
options.text: volcanic activity at the plate boundaries

options.label: c
options.text: friction between the core and the mantle

questions.question: The Atlantic Ocean is about 5,000km wide. It is thought that is has been widening by about 2cm per year since it first formed. How many years has it taken to reach its present width?
What causes the tectonic plates to move?

options.label: d
options.text: Weight of the land on top of the plate

questions.question: There are volcanic islands in several places in the mid-Atlantic Ocean. They have probably been formed there because...

options.label: a
options.text: magma has erupted until it is above sea level

options.label: b
options.text: the tides have washed up a mound of sediment

options.label: c
options.text: there is debris from oil drilling

options.label: d
options.text: sediments have piled up along an oceanic ridge
